Uses of Interface
jdraw.framework.Figure

    • Uses of Figure in jdraw.framework

      Methods in jdraw.framework that return Figure 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      Figure Figure.clone()
      Returns a clone of this figure.
      Figure DrawModelEvent.getFigure()
      Returns the figure which initiated the event.
      Figure FigureEvent.getFigure()
      Returns the figure which changed.
      Figure FigureHandle.getOwner()
      Gets the handle's owner.
      Methods in jdraw.framework that return types with arguments of type Figure 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      java.lang.Iterable<Figure> FigureGroup.getFigureParts()
      Returns the parts of a figure which consists of several parts.
      java.lang.Iterable<Figure> DrawModel.getFigures()
      Returns an iterator which can be used to iterate over all figures of a draw model.
      java.util.List<Figure> DrawView.getSelection()
      Returns a list which contains the currently selected figures.
      Methods in jdraw.framework with parameters of type Figure 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void DrawModel.addFigure​(Figure f)
      Adds a new figure to the draw model.
      void DrawView.addToSelection​(Figure f)
      Adds a figure to the selected figures.
      void DrawModel.removeFigure​(Figure f)
      Removes a given figure from the draw model.
      void DrawView.removeFromSelection​(Figure f)
      Removes a figure from the selected figures.
      void DrawModel.setFigureIndex​(Figure f, int index)
      Sets the index of a given figure.
      Constructors in jdraw.framework with parameters of type Figure 
      Constructor Description
      DrawModelEvent​(DrawModel source, Figure figure, DrawModelEvent.Type type)
      Constructs a DrawModelEvent object with the specified model.
      FigureEvent​(Figure source)
      Constructs a FigureEvent object with the specified figure.
